org.mundo.net.transport
Interface ITransportConnection

All Known Subinterfaces:
IIPTransportConnection
All Known Implementing Classes:
TCPTransportConnection, UDPTransportConnection
public interface ITransportConnection

Transport connections implement this interface. A transport connection is a point-to-point link to an adjacent node. Transport connections are opened and managed by transport services.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
ITransportService

Method Summary
 boolean checkTimeout(int elapsed)
          Periodically called by a routing service to update the timeout counters and to close unused connections.

Method Detail

getLink

TransportLink getLink()
Returns the associated transport link object.

Returns:
the associated transport link object.

getMetric

int getMetric()
Returns the metric value of this connection. The routing service always tries to use the connection with the lowest value. This method always returns a valid value. If the connection is closed, the returned value is as if the connection were open (or only minimally different).

Returns:
the metric value.

connect

boolean connect()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Opens the connection.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

disconnect

void disconnect()
Closes the connection.

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Returns whether the connection is open.

Returns:
true if the connection is open; false otherwise.

checkTimeout

boolean checkTimeout(int elapsed)
Periodically called by a routing service to update the timeout counters and to close unused connections.

Returns:
true if the connection is still open, false if not.

send

boolean send(Message msg)
Sends the specified message to the remote peer.

Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
